channel.title: Whoopee
channel.description: Explore the power and versatility of Lua programming language. From beginner tutorials to advanced techniques. From beginner tutorials to advanced techniques, dive into Lua's elegant syntax and discover its applications in game development, scripting, embedded software and more. Also some useful stuff for web-development.

item.title: Compiling Lua for MS-DOS/FreeDOS
item.description: A step-by-step guide how to compile the Lua programming language interpreter for MS-DOS or FreeDOS.

item.title: A Step-by-Step Guide to Creating a Bootable FreeDOS Flash Drive with a Live CD
item.description: Learn to set up a bootable FreeDOS USB for running legacy software and games, BIOS updates, or system recovery. This quick guide covers formatting, bootable media creation, and installation in simple steps.

item.title: Polygons and rectangles intersection
item.description: Polysec is a framework-agnostic Lua library for detecting intersections and collisions between polygons and rectangles. It provides an efficient algorithm for polygonal intersection detection, making it suitable for the collision handling. While Polysec is independent of any specific framework, examples demonstrating its usage are provided using the Löve2D game development engine.

item.title: Strictly typed Lua
item.description: Explanation of the typing system in the Lua language provided by Lua Language Server Annotations. Learn how to annotate types for your projects and functions.

item.title: Testing multiple Lua versions with Laura and GitHub Actions
item.description: This demonstration showcases the process of testing a piece of code across six different versions of the Lua programming language. The goal is to ensure compatibility, identify potential issues, and observe any differences in behavior between versions. By running these tests, we can assess the code’s performance, stability, and necessary adjustments for seamless functionality across all Lua versions.

item.title: Printing a table in Lua tutorial
item.description: By default, Lua does not provide a built-in tool to print the structure of a table. While there are many existing solutions available online, this tutorial will guide you through creating your own custom function to inspect and display Lua tables in a clear and readable format. By implementing this yourself, you'll gain a deeper understanding of Lua tables and how to work with them efficiently.

item.title: Hot to quit Vim and NeoVim
item.description: Quitting Vim or Neo is very challenging to people open vim for the first time.

item.title: Turn NeoVim into Lua IDE
item.description: A comprehensive step-by-step guide on transforming Neovim into a fully functional Integrated Development Environment (IDE) specifically tailored for Lua development

item.title: Iterators
item.description: An article provides a detailed explanation of iterators in Lua, including their purpose, functionality, and usage. It also includes practical examples to demonstrate how iterators work and how they can be implemented effectively in Lua programs.

item.title: How to split string in Lua
item.description: Example how to split string in Lua with generic function considering utf8.

item.title: Understanding Coroutines in Lua
item.description: Coroutines are a powerful tool in Lua language to provide asynchronous programming, but these might be a bit hard to understand for beginners.

item.title: Monochrome 1-bit image parsing
item.description: Sime guide about 1-bit monochrome images: how to parse meta data from 1-bit bitmap files. Creating monochrome images with ImageMagick, GIMP, MS Paint, and other image processing software.

item.title: Using Lua Command Line Client (CLI)
item.description: Understanding chunks in Lua: local and global variable scope, loading, and execution chunks independently from the host program.

item.title: What are chunks in Lua?
item.description: Understanding chunks in Lua: local and global variable scope, loading, and execution chunks independently from the host program.

item.title: How does the three dots parameter work in Lua?
item.description: A function that can accept a variable number of arguments is called a variadic function, which is indicated by three dots ('...') vararg expressions at the end of its argument list. Explanation of how variadic functions and vararg expression work in Lua.

item.title: Bitwise operations in Lua
item.description: Explaining bitwise operators in Lua language and its application in practice.

item.title: Logic in Lua: AND, OR, NOT, XOR, NXOR
item.description: Definitive guide to logical operation in Lua. Ternary logical operator in Lua. Truth tables for AND, OR, NOT, XOR, NXOR.

item.title: Documentation for Laura unit-testing framework
item.description: Documentation for Laura is a lightweight unit-testing framework for Lua with simplicity in mind.

item.title: String buffers in Lua
item.description: Working with string in Lua in performant way, using string buffers.

item.title: A definitive guide for compiling Lua from source code
item.description: Compiling Lua from the source code is an extremely easy procedure and every beginner in programming can do it, without any problems. Here is a detailed guide on how to compile Lua from the source code.

item.title: Single vs double quotes in Lua
item.description: There is no technical difference between single and double quotes in strings in Lua language. Just choose the style of quotes that you like and use it.

item.title: Lua Syntax Cheat Sheet (Short Version)
item.description: Very brief syntax cheat sheet of Lua language syntax. Download PDF of Lua cheat sheet.

item.title: Profile for Löve2D
item.description: LoveProfiler is an extremely simple logger and profiler for Löve2D framework.

item.title: Graph
item.description: Definitive guide and implementation of the graphs in Lua language. Graph is one of the most important data structures, used in different kinds of advanced algorithms, like pathfinding, detecting cycles, logistics, maps, etc.

item.title: Rounding a number to step
item.description: Rounding integers to a given step is a very common task, sometimes asked at technical interviews and very often such a task appears in daily jobs.

item.title: Puff lightweight CSS framework
item.description: Full-featured CSS micro framework (~2kb gzip) that is maintained. Extremely light CSS framework for rapid user interface prototyping.

item.title: Get rid of impostor syndrome in 60 seconds
item.description: The most effective way to get rid of impostor syndrome in 60 seconds. Technique based on imaginary and associative thinking.

item.title: Priority queue
item.description: Implementation of the priority queue in Lua. Priority queue is an abstract data type similar to queue and stack. The difference is that each element has a priority value. Values with higher priority are pulled first.

item.title: Variety of linked lists
item.description: Linked list is a classical data structure that can be used as data storage for different algorithms and efficient data management.

item.title: Tuple
item.description: Tuple is a data structure where values are ordered and unchangeable. In Lua, tuples are implemented as tables.

item.title: Set
item.description: Set is a data structure with a collection of values where the value in the set may only occur once; it is unique in the set's collection. Check set implementation in Lua. -

item.title: Circular doubly linked list
item.description: Circular doubly linked list is a data structure that is a combination of both circular singly linked list and doubly linked list. It stores 2 pointers, one is pointing to the next node, the other to the previous node and the first pointer points to the last and correspondingly last to the first. This approach makes a continual circular loop.

item.title: Doubly linked list
item.description: Doubly linked list is a data structure similar to a singly linked list. With one significant difference: it stores 2 pointers, one is pointing to the next node, the other to the previous node. Check implementation of doubly linked list in Lua programming language.

item.title: Circular linked list
item.description: A cicrular linked list is a data structure similar to linear singly linked list for storing and managing collections of data. All nodes are linked in a continuous circle. Circular linked list implementation in Lua.

item.title: Linked list
item.description: A linked list is a fundamental data structure in computer science used for storing and managing collections of data. Linked list implementation in Lua.

item.title: List
item.description: List abstract data structure in Lua language. Implementation of append, prepend, contains and find methods.

item.title: Arctangent function in Lua
item.description: math.atan and math.atan2 in Lua. Explanation of arctangent function and why it is inconsistent in different versions of Lua.

item.title: Types in Lua: References vs Values
item.description: Explanation of what means 'pass by value' and 'pass by reference' in Lua language. Difference between simple values and reference types.

item.title: Deque or double-ended queue
item.description: Deque or double-ended queue abstract data structure in Lua language. Implementation of push front, push back, pop front and pop back methods.

item.title: Queue
item.description: Queue abstract data structure in Lua language. Implementation of enqueue, dequeue, isEmpty, front and rear methods.

item.title: Stack
item.description: Stack abstract data structure in Lua language. Implementation of push, pop and isEmpty methods.

item.title: Object-oriented programming in Lua
item.description: Object-oriented tutorial for Lua language. Examples with metatables, classes-, closure-, prototype-based and inheritance.

item.title: StyLua is an optimized code formatter for Lua
item.description: StyLua is an amazing code formatter inspired by prettier.

item.title: Lua cheatsheet
item.description: Definite guide of Lua syntax in one place.

item.title: warn, error and print functions in Lua
item.description: Lua has some useful functions for debugging and error handling: print, warn, and error. Here are some tricks to using them.

item.title: Getting started with Lua
item.description: Get stared with Lua programming language. A brief introduction to Lua language. Installation, compilation, REPL guide.
